dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAINLESS STEEL walls and counters. Dishes CLANGING. STEA and SMOKE rising. COOKS in a fury. WAITERS and WAITRESSES yelling, frantically picking up their orders.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISH AREA
dialogues.text: The commotion continues as more WAITERS and WAITRESSES un an endless supply of dirty dishes. But on the other side of the dish counter there is order; MORGAN WRIGHT stands in the "pit," racking the dishes wit speed and precision, talking to the NEW GUY.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Dish washing is like life, once you get behind you can never catch up. Morgan sprays down a rack of dishes and launches it into HOBART (dishwasher). Morgan is 23 years old, tall, thin, wears the look of a Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) You've got to spray the dishes down. This thing'll sanatize'em but it won't really wash'em. You can't sacrifice quality for speed. And as the Hobart spits out the clean dishes, JASON FLETC unloads them. Jason's a solid six feet, mature looking fo

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (to the new guy) Be careful, if you hang out with him long enough you'll learn to like him.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Quiet please. Jason whisks a load of dishes away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's just so many different little things to this job. Morgan grabs a dark green rack.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Like these dark green racks are much better for these boats then the light green ones. The light green ones are better for plates. It's just practice. It's all practice. Morgan shoves the dark green rack of "boats" into the Hob

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Full wine glass. And the WAITRESS flips the wine glass rack over to Morgan he shoves it into the Hobart.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Is it busy tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Not really. With three of us, we should be able to toy with this. A WAITER pokes his head out of the office, yells:

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Morgan, phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan sits at one of the desks talking into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You're still going through with it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can you believe that shit?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: ",.. and you shall change froma man with a future to a man with a past."

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No... now I'm a man with a future... and a past! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We'll be there Friday morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan enters. Jason's in the pit racking the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: David's selling out.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: That's a problem. They're really going to do it? Morgan nods.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We going?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, to try and talk him out of it. Another clean rack of dishes exits the Hobart.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's the new guy?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I thought he was with you. Jason yells across the kitchen to the MANAGER:

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's your boy? Worried, the manager moves to the dish area.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: What'd you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Looks like you lost another dish dog.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: What'd you guys do to him?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (yells) Has anyone seen the new guy? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I saw him walk out the back door. Jason pulls the new guy's abandoned apron out of the line bag and holds it up. Morgan and Jason laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Shit! Fucking dish dog! Can you guys stay for a few more days?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Sorry... we got an execution to go to.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: And the Dish Dog theme song starts to play. It's an upbea fast paced song about freedom and being on the open road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The license plate is attached to BLACK BEAUTY, a 1958 For 100, pick-up truck. Black Beauty wears a rough coat of bl paint and is missing all four hubcaps. The truck races away from Armorillo Texas, past the "Leav Armorillo" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason drives, while Morgan sits in the passenger seat rea a beat up old map.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Nope. Morgan highlights Armorillo Texas. Dozens of cities in th Southwest have already been highlighted.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You got to go to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No. We got to make it to Oklahoma City if we're going to make it by Friday. Jason looks away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You going to see Molly?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the truck passes the "Welcome to Oklahoma" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck begins to lurch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason steers off to the side of the highway.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We're not out of gas... it's got to be the fuel pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason gets out, immediately moving to the side of the roa take a leak. Morgan opens the hood and stares at the engi Jason joins Morgan and goes to work. He pulls off a hose from the engine and covers it with his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Try and crank it. Morgan gets into the truck and turns the engine over.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's good. It's the fuel pump.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Can we fix it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Dude... toy. Jason goes to the back of the truck, opens up an extensiv tool kit and pulls out another fuel pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it drives through Oklahoma City. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Truck drives past the "Entering Arkansas" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan pumps the gas as Jason arrives at the truck carryi handful of snacks.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What'd you get?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Jason gets back into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What'd you spend ten bucks on snacks?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No, about Eight-fifty. Morgan gets back into the passenger seat and the truck lumbers away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the truck drives over the Mississippi River, into Memp Tennessee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the truck continues East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the truck passes the "Welcome to North Carolina- First Flight" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads: "Greensboro 13" The truck drives by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the truck enters Greensboro. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The temperature gauge nears 240 degrees. Morgan and Jason notice.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's getting a little hot, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Don't worry a thing about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck maneuvers through the bumper to bumper traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck turns off, into an upper-middle class neighborh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck rolls to a stop. Light steam rises out of the engine and green anti-freeze boils onto the street and ru into the gutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason pats the dashboard, says:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: This is a lot of truck for four- fifty.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Touche’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Morgan and Jason get out of the truck and walk toward WRIGHT'S HOUSE; it's white bred, middle-class America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vacuum roars. MRS. NORMA WRIGHT pushes it back and fo and as she turns she sees Morgan and Jason standing in th doorway holding a few bags. Mrs. Wright turns the vacuum off.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We came back for David's wedding. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WRIGHT
dialogues.text: You should have called. Your father will be so happy you're home.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We're going back on the road in a few days. Morgan walks past Mrs. Wright, up the stairs. Jason follows, says:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It's good to see you again Mrs. Wright. Mrs. Wright nods and watches as they climb the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We'll be back later. We're going to see the professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck rests on the street in front of PROFESSOR FROST house. Frost's house stands out from the other middle- cl homes, it's more... artsy. There's a few pieces of "moder art" littering the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dishwashing is to me a soapy salvation, rejuvenation for my soul, recuperation from my upbringing, rejection of the bourgeoisie, reclamation of my will, and refuge from a teleological hurricane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan sits in a wicker chair.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) With each dish I wash it's one less tie I have to wear. With each pot I scrub it's one less mortgage payment I have to make-- PROFESSOR FROST sits across from Morgan, smoking a pipe a drinking orange juice from a glass bottle. He's nearing 6 bearded, and wears sandals and shorts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) --with each glass I rack it's one less trip to Disneyland I have to take with my ingrate children, and each time I crank up Black Beauty, it's one less car payment I have to make. Professor Frost claps and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: How much longer do you think you can keep doing it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I think we could stay out there at least another couple of years.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: About 37 states. Maybe will hit Europe after that. We've covered almost the entire south, all the way out to the west coast. Morgan pulls the map out of his backpack, carefully unfol it and lays it out on the coffee table in front of Frost.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I've got to tell you, when you packed out of here a year ago in that truck, I didn't think you'd make it past Georgia. It sounds like you're really doing what you want. Morgan and Jason smile, gloat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID ALEXANDER drives, blond hair, blue eyes, conservati SHANE MARTIN, dark, nearing six foot and 220 pounds sits the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: So fellas, what's up? Jason and Morgan are in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Dish doggin' it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  10.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. How do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's wet.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Yeah... So fellas, what's the word?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Marriage.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Our boy's getting married.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Isn't that crazy? It's not scaring me as much as it should.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Was it just a nightmare getting everything together? David looks into the rear view mirror to check his hair; short, slicked back, all in place.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Not for me. All the decisions were pretty much made by Karen and my mom.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Is your family pretty excited?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Weddings are one big excuse for people to get pissed off at each other. My mom and my dad's mom have done nothing but yell at each other for a month.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What were they fighting about?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: My Grandmother is like, " Why wasn't Uncle Richard invited?" And we're just like, "because we haven't seen him in fifteen years." And then Nanny, my mom's mom, wants to invite three of her friends, who we don't even know. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  11.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And she went to Karen's mom, who's to nice to say "no," so then my other Grandmother wants to invite some of her friends. General laughter.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How's the job?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I still like it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) I just finished my first audit.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Was it as bad Granger said it would be?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't that bad. It wasn't an unqualified report.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (to Shane) How's your job?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I fucking hate it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Fucking fraud administrator... Yeah, I know it sounds great but all I do is wait by my computer for someone to call me up and bitch me out. "I got a fucking sixty- thousand dollar phone bill. What the fuck are you going to do about it?"

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Sixty-thousand dollars? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  12.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Sometimes more. People'd steal those chips and duplicate them. There'd be calls to places like India.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Any chicks?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I struck out with this older lady.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How much older?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Fucking forty-two.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Shane! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You know, we went out, seemed to have a good time, and she avoided me from then on.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Dude, you should come with us on the road.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll strap another chair in the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I might just do that.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Have you guys seen the Professor?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we were just there.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: So what's up with him? He just doesn't seem like a happy guy to me.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  13.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I mean does he seem like a happy person to you?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I don't think he cares about being happy. There's something much more important than that. He's content. Content to know that he's lived his life the way he wanted. He didn't let women or society trap him.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's about the only person I know that's lived their life with any semblance of free will. If that doesn't lead to happiness, it leads to a helluva lot more. Jason points at the street sign, says to David:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Take a left up here. David gets in the left lane.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's do a drive through.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You guys been back since graduation?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN/ JASON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acura turns onto Guilford College Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oldest Co-ed college in the country, founded by The Soci of Friends in 1848," reads the sign at the entrance to campus. The Acura drives past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David rounds the first turn in the campus road. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  14.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I guess there's no students?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: The Eastern Music Festival just ended.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Just think, the people that were Sophomores when we graduated are going to be the seniors. Morgan considers this.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. David stops the car in front of ENGLISH HALL. They stare the building for a moment, remembering. It's a nondescrip brick dormitory.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: We really thought we were the shit.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How many times did we walk down those steps?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: A bunch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Let's go see some tittys before we all get depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David revs the engine and they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fanciest strip club in Greensboro; red carpet, brass railings, and monied rednecks. And the girls: beautiful and plentiful; giving lap dances standing at the bar counting their tips, dancing on one o the three stages, serving drinks. It's dark and the music blares and Jason and David sit by main stage ogling LINDA LIPPS. The songs ends and the announcer comes over the P.A.: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  15.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Let's have a big hand for Linda! Remember gentlemen, these lovely ladies only work for your tips, so bring out those wallets and show them your appreciation... And now, you've seen her in Penthouse, you've seen her on your T.V., let's have a big hand for... Sindee Coxx. The lights go down and the music goes up, and then the spotlight finds... SINDEE COXX, as she runs through the smoke in a cowboy costume, and jumps onto the stage. BANG! BANG! as Sindee let's off a couple of rounds from her six-shooter. The music blares. The monied rednecks start hootin' and hollerin'. Shane and Morgan sit at a small table by themselves. A WAITRESS approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You guys need anything? Morgan shakes his head, looks around, takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Jason and David watch as Sindee takes off her chaps to re only a G-string. David guzzles a beer as he stuffs a doll bill between Sindee's naked breasts.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Morgan stares across the room.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Check that out. Shane looks, it's a BEAUTIFUL STRIPPER giving a lap dance a heavy middle-aged REDNECK. He attempts to fondle her an she playfully pushes his hands away.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wonder how much that cost? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  16.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: You should ask her. David and Jason join Morgan and Shane.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That's a lot of titty for a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call the girls and see if they want to join us. A WAITRESS stops at the table carrying a tray of shots in test tubes topped with cherries.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You want a body shot?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Get whatever you want, this one's on us. David wraps his arms around her waist and pulls her close whispers in her ear. She laughs and whispers something ba The music blares. The waitress puts the test tube between her breasts and brings David's face to her chest and leans forward so he swallow the drink. David smiles and pulls her closer. She takes the cherry stem in her mouth and slowly feeds him t cherry. David eats the cherry and smiles in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Karen would be pretty pleased.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm not married yet!

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You want one? Jason nods and turns and the waitress straddles him. She puts the test tube between her breast and brings Jason's to her chest and leans forward so he can swallow the drin She takes the cherry stem in her mouth and slowly feeds h the cherry. Jason pulls $10 out of his back pocket and gives it to th waitress. WAITRESS (CONT’D) Anyone else? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  17.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: No thanks. Morgan shakes his head. The waitress leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Morgan, I'm surprised you weren't all over the body shot.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You should have asked her if she dances. David chugs down another beer. Morgan looks back to the l dance only she's gone. The redneck reclines by himself, enjoying the show.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys about ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We just got here. David gets up and starts walking toward the bar, only the a stage in front of him. He jumps onto the stage and walk across, past a girl dancing, and jumps down on the other side, which is at the bar. Morgan and Jason share a look.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What is that guy thinking?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Don't even worry about it, we're out of here. Morgan exits.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: A bouncer stares down at David.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: You need to calm the fuck down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Morgan exits Baby Dolls, he passes the beautiful strip that he watched give a lap dance. Her name is ANNE. Their eyes meet. As Morgan's almost past her she says: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  18.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You got a cigarette? Morgan stops, turns around.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No... I don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh... okay.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about starting though.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, why is that?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You know, you get to use a lot more of your sick days. You die earlier. And then I'd have a cigarette when beautiful girls asked me for one. Anne smiles and turns away from Morgan. Morgan walks to t Acura and gets in. A moment later Anne jumps in after him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It's cold out there.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's a hundred degrees.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It's cold in here.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's a hundred degrees in here, too.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Okay, you win, game over. My name's Anne. She holds out her hand. Morgan shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Morgan. And there's an awkward silence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  19.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyways.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Doesn't your friend lock the door?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I left it unlocked so I had some place to go when I wanted to leave early.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You're funny.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Anyways...

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Stop saying that, it's making me feel like you don't want to talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I say it when I don't have anything to say.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Tell me how much you love me... don't answer that.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Anyways...

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Stop saying that!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Okay... Do you like being a stripper?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I love it. I don't have to worry about what I'm going to wear to work.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You're funny, too... Any-(stopping himself) Do you make a lot of money? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Not really. It's like waiting tables, everyone likes to talk about how much money they make, but it's like four hundred on a good week, two hundred on a bad week. I'm not going to get rich or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck sits in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason sit at a booth with the manager, DEREK LILLY.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We may only be here for a few days, but we offer a few guarantees: we'll be here on time, we won't walk out in the middle of the shift, and we'll give at least 24 hours notice.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: You sound like hard working young men, but I'm sorry, I just hired two new guys. Morgan holds out his hand to LILLY.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Morgan are walking to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Have you ever met anyone that you absolutely can't stand, but there's no real reason why? Morgan laughs. They get into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MANAGER shakes his head, "no." Jason extends his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Morgan pass the two DISH WASHERS as they enter. of the dish washers takes his apron off and throws it int the dumpster. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  42.

dialogues.speaker: DISH WASHER
dialogues.text: They ain't paying me enough to wash all them dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.J., the manager, nods his head as he shakes hands with Morgan and Jason. E.J. pulls out two aprons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan stands in the pit, leaning against the counter. Jason's looking under the glass rack at the waitresses.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Not much to look at.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I'd be inclined to agree with you on that one. They watch as a few WAITRESSES (all unattractive) pick up there orders at the window.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Jason exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When are you coming back? Jason stops to think for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no dishes as Morgan and Jason wait around.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You going to hit on any of these girls?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Probably not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  43.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Why not? You'd probably have a good chance with that one over there. (pointing to Martha) MARTHA (5'2" and 350 pounds) lifts a huge tray of food on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: If I was that desperate I'd just call your mom.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: If I was that desperate I'd call Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason clean up...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You stay here and work, I'm going to see if they're hiring down at Hooters.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I don't think there's a hooters in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason lay awake in the tent.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: That was pretty brutal, it was just so freakin' slow.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'll Say.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Maybe we should work tomorrow night and get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah... Maybe we should head back to Greensboro?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What for? To see Molly?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No, but we could save some money. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Let's just keep going west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How's married life treating you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You ever tried one of those "ice" beers?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They're pretty good, and they got twice the alcohol content. By the way, who's Anne?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Anne? Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She called here looking for you. This strikes Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason stands in the pit, waiting for dishes. Morgan enter

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What did David have to say?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's going pretty well, he's become an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck pulls out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck picks up speed as it heads north. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The temperature gauge nears 240 degrees. Morgan and Jason notice.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: She's running a little hot, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'll check it at the next gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan pumps gas. Jason stuffs his face with a hot dog, p a bag of food into the truck, pops the hood and gets back out. Morgan finishes, gets into the truck. Jason grabs a bottle of anti-freeze from the back and pou it into the radiator. Finished, Jason slams the hood down and gets back into the truck. The truck roars to life and pulls away. A puddle of anti-freeze lies on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason downs another hot dog, offers one to Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You want some? Morgan shakes his head and pulls out his coleman water co and a sandwich. Jason eats the last hot dog and sets a bag of chips and a soda on the dash board in front of Morgan. Morgan doesn't for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the truck continues west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck drives into town. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck sits in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason sit at the bar. The MANAGER prepares the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We may only be here for a few days, but we offer a few guarantees: we'll be here on time, we won't walk out in the middle of the shift, and we'll give at least 24 hours notice.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: I had to fire the last bunch of dish dogs ‘cause they were throwing the dishes into the river instead of washing'em. The Manager heaves a garbage can of empty liquor bottles the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll tell you what, I'll use you as long as I can, but if I can find someone permanently, you'll have to make a decision.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason put on their aprons. Jason motions to a group of WAITRESSES standing at the ca register (all attractive).

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: This looks a little better.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You going to hit on any of them?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Probably. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  47.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Not very well. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moderate flow of dishes come into Morgan, who stands in pit. Jason unloads the clean dishes.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: This dishwasher sucks. Morgan looks, Jason holds up one of the plates. It's stil dirty.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run'em through again. Jason takes the rack and hands it to Morgan. Morgan pushe it back into the Hobart.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude. Jason motions to one of the Waitresses as she exits out t back door.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see that?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Go for it. Jason goes to the soda fountain, draws two sodas and exit out the backdoor.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GRILL
dialogues.text: One of the COOKS turns to TROY, who's kneeling down at th refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: I think that dish dog just went after your girl. Troy looks at the backdoor, stands up. He's 6'4" and 250 pounds of pure muscle. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jason exits. The waitress puffs on a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Sure is hot out here.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I'll say. Could I have a sip of one of your drinks?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You can have one. Jason smiles and hands her the drink.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continued) My name's Jason.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Bridget. And as they shake hands the door swings open and Troy exi

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Troy-

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Bridget tries to hold Troy back.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: This is my fucking girl. Troy steps forward and grabs Jason by the collar and slam him up against the building.

dialogues.speaker: TROY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You new guys come in here and think it's open season. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Troy, he's a dish dog. I'm not going to fuck around with a dish dog.
Troy releases his grip on Jason, and Jason stumbles back the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jason returns, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Not... really... very well. You know that cook named Troy?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: That big guy?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I pretty much got toyed with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It's going alright, not great, but... alright.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh- hold on, I thought I heard someone at the door. Jason waits.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm back.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one. So how's Black Beauty?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: She's been running kind of hot but- A HISS in the background. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  50.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) What was that?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My hair spray.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Are you going out?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. How's Morgan doing?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Fine. Who are you going out with?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just some guy.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Do I know him?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Did he go to Guilford?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I don't think you knew him.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What was his name?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Jon what?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jon Dunkle.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I knew him. The DOORBELL rings in the background.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's here. I got to go. CLICK, as Molly hangs up on Jason. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Jason kicks a bucket, sending it down the hall, as puts a stack of dishes away.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Jason takes the empty dish rack and throws it down. He starts to unload a clean rack but they're dirty.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This sucks. Check the soap. Jason slams another rack of washed dishes back through th dish washer. Morgan moves to the automatic soap dispenser. Checks it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We're out.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Great. Jason walks to the office, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KITCHEN MANAGER talks on the phone. Jason enters.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (very polite) Excuse me, we need more soap for the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN MANAGER
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, we've been out for a couple of days. Just wash'em by hand. He goes back to his phone conversation. Jason pauses a moment in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jason returns. Morgan's busy trying to stack the dishe and the stacks are getting high. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  52.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: They're out of soap.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You're shittin' me. Jason shakes his head. The Manager approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you guys doing? Get to work.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Get some soap.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: What? What did you say to me?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: There's no more soap.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: So? Wash'em by hand.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: When are you getting more soap?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Who the fuck cares? I didn't hire you to ask questions. Get to work. Morgan looks at Jason and nods.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Alright, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Good... And remember, you guys said you'd never walk out.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds. Jason smiles. The Manager gives them a funny look, not comprehending, and walks away. Jason and Morgan look at e other then at the back door... and the Dish Dog theme song starts to rise up and... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door swings open. Jason and Morgan exit, ripping off their aprons and throwing them on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason drives, Morgan's in the passenger seat. They come t stop at the intersection for interstate 50; 50 east to th right, 50 west to the left.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just go back to Greensboro?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: west. Jason guns the engine and slams the truck left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck races away from Jefferson City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Morgan sit in silence. THE TEMPERATURE GAUGE slowly rises, past 240 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck races past a billboard: "JACK IN THE BOX - NEXT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason sees the sign.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No. Jason takes the next exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck pulls up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: May I take your order? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  54.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'll have a Jumbo Jack with no tomatoes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (to Morgan) You want anything?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (into microphone) That's it. Jason pulls the truck forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jason drives he bites into his Jumbo Jack and tomatoes squish out into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Fuck! Jason rolls down the window and pitches the Jumbo Jack, wrapper and all, out the window. He picks the pieces of tomatoes off his lap and throws them out the window, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Don't you think she's running a little hot? Jason presses on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corn fields and cow pastures. The truck drives by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Morgan sit in silence and... STEAM starts to pour out from under the hood and... the engine starts KNOCKING and begins losing power. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jason turns the key off.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Black Beauty slowly rolls to a stop. Jason gets out and slams the hood open. Steam pours out. Morgan joins Jason.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Fucking piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: The head's cracked. Jason reaches in towards the engine...

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck! --as he rips his arm out, burned. He spins around, sees a rock, goes for it, picks it up and hurls it at the front the truck.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking piece of shit. Jason moves back to the truck. They stare at the engine. Morgan finally says:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: So how was that Jumbo Jack? Jason looks at Morgan, still pissed, and a smile reluctan crosses his face and Morgan starts smiling, too. They bot start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Morgan are sitting on the ground in front of th truck. A corn field grows behind them. The road sits in front of the them but no cars drive past. Jason tosses a pebble into the road. Morgan gets up and g to the truck. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Morgan grabs the soda and chips off the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan returns to Jason and sits back down. Morgan opens the bag of chips and eats one. Jason looks a him.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You want some?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Well, looks like you should have planned ahead. Morgan pops the soda and takes a long swig.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I recommend you given me a chip before I kick your ass. Morgan digs around in the bag of chips and offers Jason t smallest chip he can find. They both laugh as Morgan hand him the bag of chips and soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason are still sitting on the ground. Off in the distance, POP-POP, POP-POP, the faint sound of tractor can be heard approaching. Up ahead an old JOHN DEERE TRACTOR turns the corner and c into view. Morgan and Jason stand up and watch as the tractor approaches. The tractor stops in front of them, the FARME says:

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: That's a nice truck.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You wanna buy it? The Farmer squints at the truck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  57.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: How much you want for it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'm just kidding. It's gota cracked head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tractor pulls the truck down the country road. Morgan and Jason sit in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Population: 1330 The Corn Chowder Capital of the world. The tractor pulls the truck past the Lutheran Church into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tractor comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmer, Jason, Morgan, and EARL, the mechanic, stare at the straight six, long-stroke engine.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You boys know you're supposed to put water in these things? Earl thinks this is funny, smiles at his little joke.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (mocking) You are? Earl stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: I can get it, but it's going to take a few days.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: How much is it going to cost?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Three fifty, plus labor.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Three fifty? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  58.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Plus labor.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I can put it on. Earl shoots the farmer a look.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Where's the closest restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Over there. The farmer points up the street. EXT. STREET —- HUNTERTOWN - DAY Morgan and Jason are walking along the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I hate to say anything like this, but maybe we should sell the truck and take a bus back to Greensboro.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Black Beauty will not be sold. How much money you got?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: About twelve bucks... Morgan looks away.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continued) We walked out without getting paid, remember? That's all I got left. How much do you have?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Almost fifty.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What about the three hundred?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: That's for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Whatever. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason are walking through the parking lot, pas pick-up trucks and tractors, toward the entrance. As they enter, they pass a couple of FARMERS, complete wi jean jackets and John Deere hats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESSES scurry around. FAMILIES eat, talk, and stack their plates at the food bar. Jason and Morgan enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason sit at a booth talking with RELMA, the manager/head waitress. She's nearing seventy, short and heavy set, wears a hair net.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: -but we'll only be here for a week. Relma lights a cigarette, considers their offer, coughs violently.

dialogues.speaker: RELMA
dialogues.text: Okay... but it gets pretty busy around here.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Toy. Relma stares at Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: How'd it go with Jon?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not really that good. He's kind of a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We just didn't have much to say to each other. I got Leo. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly lies on the bed with LEO, a stuffed bear, talking i the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I really like him.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: When are you coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason pauses, watches as Morgan paces in the background.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: A week. We got to get the truck fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is small, not cluttered by all the expensive machinery that has filled the other dish rooms. The dishwasher is a vintage 1971 Hobart. Jason and Morgan stand by the dishwasher waiting for dish to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: This place must do a helluva lunch business, cause it sure doesn't do much dinner business.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I'll say. Relma appears in the doorway holding a bucket and two scr brushes.

dialogues.speaker: RELMA
dialogues.text: You got time to lean, you got time to clean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the gorilla racks is pushed away from the wall. Ja stands behind it scrubbing the wall while Morgan kneels o the floor scrubbing the lower portion. They look at each other, say: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  61.

dialogues.speaker: JASON/MORGAN
dialogues.text: I blame you for this.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT FIVE DAYS
dialogues.text: Morgan and Jason wash a pile of pots and pans. A cook dro an empty pot in front of them, only there is chili burned the bottom of it. Morgan and Jason scrub the employee BATHROOM. Besides, when a man gets married, he goes from a man with a future to man with a past.

dialogues.text: Why exactly did you choose this movie? And Anne looks up at Morgan and moves close to him and he looks at her and tries to hold back and they kiss. The fi kiss is quick. The second kiss is longer, deeper. And the third kiss is even longer and deeper. Anne flips the television off, creating complete darkness The kissing continues and their hands start to roam aroun each other's bodies.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, we can keep going, and we can do anything you want but- but that's not going to make you my girlfriend. It's not going to mean anything. Anne pulls away.

dialogues.text: Does it have gold in the glove box that I don't know about? Morgan goes to the glove box, grabs the old beat up map.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's ain't gold.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah it is. I got to have five hundred. Larry thinks about it and...

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive down Battleground Road.

dialogues.speaker: DEWIT
dialogues.text: Did you hear about that train wreck down in Madison county? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Anne shakes her head, "no."

dialogues.speaker: DEWIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Nigger went and run the train right off the tracks. Know how I knew it was a nigger? Anne stares out the window. Tears stream down her face.

dialogues.speaker: DEWIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Cause I seen the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan runs through the street, sweating, breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is parked. Dewit and Anne sit in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: DEWIT
dialogues.text: Let's go. Anne wipes her face. They get out. They're in the Super 8 Motel parking lot. Anne looks back toward the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Morgan races into the parking lot, out of breath but determined to keep going.

dialogues.text: the BOUNCER tries to stop Morgan but he runs past him.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Morgan enters, scanning the room for Anne, but she's n there. Morgan stops Susan.

dialogues.text: Where's Anne?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Where'd she go? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now the bouncer is on Morgan, pulling him out the doo

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Boy, you're going to make me mad if you're not careful.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (to Susan) I've got the money. (screaming now) Where'd he take her?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: He took her to the Super 8. And now the bouncer can't pull Morgan anymore because Morgan's on his feet running out the door. Morgan's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feet pumping, breath labored, Morgan runs across the stre through a stop light, through traffic. He keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowing, exhausted, determined, Morgan pushes himself on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Morgan rounds the corner into the parking lot, screami

dialogues.text: Annnnnnnnnne! Morgan goes straight to the office.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: A- a girl- an-and a redneck. Whe- where are they?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Do you have a name?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Anne... The Young man checks his book. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we don't have anyone under that name registered here. Morgan runs out.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you check the Motel 6?

dialogues.text: as Morgan exits the office and starts running past the ro doors, KNOCKING loudly on each one, yelling:

dialogues.speaker: ANNNNNNNE
dialogues.text: And people start coming out of their rooms to see what al the commotion is about and Morgan keeps yelling:

dialogues.speaker: ANNNNNE
dialogues.text: And now Morgan's at the end of the row. He bounds up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: ANNNNNNE
dialogues.text: and continues BANGING on the second story doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ANNNNE
dialogues.text: Anne turns on the light. Dewit lies on the bed, naked. Anne's down to just her panties and bra and she goes for door and... Dewit goes for her but she swings the door open... and Morgan stumbles by and stops instantly. He slowly enters.

dialogues.speaker: DEWIT
dialogues.text: Why don't you just run along. Your girl friend has a debt to pay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: (to Anne) Get dressed. Anne starts to get dressed. Morgan pulls out the $800 and throws it on the bed. Dewit snatches it up, starts counti it, pissed as hell and still naked. Anne's dressed now. She hugs and kisses Morgan and they start to leave but... Morgan spots Dewit's car keys on the bureau and grabs the

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.text: Flowers and candles. Pew after pew of people, old and you alike, all dressed for the occasion. The MUSIC starts to swell. At the back of the church Jason and the GROOMSMEN wait. J looks at David, at the entrance, and they start walking d the isle, toward the front of the church.

dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.text: Nothin'. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: By the power vested in me, I now pronounce you husband and wife. Anne stares at Morgan dreaming of her own wedding day. Mo looks back, smiles. Jason kisses Molly.

dialogues.text: FREDDY AND THE FANTASTICS play "BABY OH BABY." The dance floor is filled with happy couples, including Karen and David, Jason and Molly, Mr. and Mrs. Wright, and Morgan a Anne. As Morgan dances past Jason he says:

dialogues.text: This is a lot of wedding for fifteen thousand dollars. And Jason laughs and "BABY OH BABY" crescendos up and peo keep dancing. And as the CAMERA pulls back we see Professor Frost and S sitting at a table alone, watching the couples dance. FADE OUT.
